attributes.action: save Taylor unit
attributes.background: I am a staff nurse who works on Taylor unit at leigh infirmary. Myself and all the staff are dedicated in the rehabilitation of patients who have suffered head injuries, and other neurological diseases. We have been informed that our unit is to close early next year.
attributes.additional_details: Taylor Unit was opened in 1994, for the people of wigan Bolton salford and leigh.  It is a dedicated neurological rehabilitation unit, offering exceptional care.

attributes.action: To teach UK pupils how food choices impact the environment
attributes.background:
No other single activity has a bigger impact on the planet than the raising of livestock for meat, milk and eggs.

By adding to the school curriculum we can introduce positive environmental change by educating pupils of how their buying behaviour and food choices effect the world we live in.
attributes.additional_details: http://science.time.com/2013/12/16/the-triple-whopper-environmental-impact-of-global-meat-production/

attributes.action: Ensure a new hospital is built central to all West Hertfordshire communities
attributes.background:
It must be purpose-built and equipped to modern standards with enough space for parking and future expansion.

We are members of the New Hospital Campaign formed to request a new hospital on a central, accessible site between the three main towns - Hemel Hempstead, St. Albans and Watford.
attributes.additional_details:
The local NHS is proposing to keep the Watford site in Vicarage Road as the acute hospital. This plan is not sustainable: it cannot meet the health needs of the people of the area. The estate requires £100m of backlog maintenance and cannot be brought up to modern standards. 

We need a new hospital that everyone can get to, which surveys have repeatedly shown patients want. The present hospital is in a congested corner of our area, next to the ground of a Premier League football club.

attributes.action: Relevant services must come together to prevent lives lost in open water yearly.
attributes.background: One 2011 July day my son Dylan went swimming at a local quarry; 20 minutes in he got into difficulty, unable to swim the short distance to safety. He reportedly died from cold water shock which has 4 stages; probably in the last stage when everything that has fought to stay alive relaxes.
attributes.additional_details: A minute earlier Dylan's rescuer could have saved his life. Currently the UK has nothing in place to prevent these needless deaths. Schools don't educate about the dangers in & around open water & there is no funding in place for prevention. Since Dylan died there has been another 2000 water related deaths. I want Dylan’s death to serve a purpose rather than for him to have died in vain. I want people to live because Dylan died.  We need change and we need it  now!

attributes.action: Only Residents and Domiciles should be allowed to own British media companies
attributes.background: In the USA there is a law that restricts the ownership of media to US citizens. Now the UK is leaving the EU we are free to do the same. Only people with a vested interest in this countries best interests should be allowed to control such powerful tools of public opinion.
attributes.additional_details: All the major owners of the pro Brexit press are either non residents in the UK or claim non domicile tax status in order to mitigate their fair share of tax. It is time to put a stop to this in the same way as the EU was trying. Let's finish the job they started.

attributes.action: Allow britain as a whole to vote for our capital londons mayor
attributes.background: We think as a nation who now is independent should have a say on who is made our capitals mayor the whole of britain should vote in for our capitals mayor
attributes.additional_details: Only london votes for the capitals mayor and we britain should have a say as it is our capital not just a city or town

attributes.action: Simplify the process of getting British citizenship for resident EU citizens
attributes.background:
EU citizens resident in the UK for at least 5 years have to be offered a simple process to gain British citizenship to ensure they have the right to remain, live and work in the UK indefinitely and irretrievably.
The current process is complicated and many families can not afford it.
attributes.additional_details:
EU citizens have built carriers, started businesses, payed taxes, contributed to the community and most importantly the UK had become their home.
The UK leaving the EU makes these EU citizens feel second class citizens in their home. They feel unwanted, discriminated and they are left in uncertainty. 
The current process for them to become British citizens is complicated and expensive. UK Government must protect the rights of these EU citizens and simplify the process of their naturalisation.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to harass a learner driver who is on a lesson.
attributes.background: It is becoming more and more dangerous for driving instructors to teach learners on UK roads as we are continually harassed by other, so called "qualified" drivers. We are cut up, sworn at, threatened and verbally abused every day. This should be treated as a "hate crime".
attributes.additional_details: I have been overtaken on many occasions while approaching a pedestrian crossing or road junction in a dangerous manner. Sooner or late, (probably sooner), this will lead to a death or serious accident involving an innocent member of the public. There are many examples on various websites to support this.

attributes.action: EU nationals to apply for British Citizenship for free
attributes.background: Future Brexit negotiations, might restrict the rights of EU nationals to continue living and working in the UK. By allowing free citizenship applications UK Government can put this right, avoiding discrimination against those with low income. Applications should be accepted until 23 June 2022.
attributes.additional_details: By facilitating EU nationals to acquire British citizenship, UK Government has the opportunity to counteract the inability of EU nationals living and working in the UK to vote at the latest Referendum. Additionally, UK Government, by allowing free citizenship applications from EU nationals, will also send a strong message to those who wants to divide our society that UK is a truly tolerant country which values those who contribute to its prosperity.

attributes.action: Remove liquid security restrictions at UK airports for operating cabin crew.
attributes.background: Remove restrictions on cabin crew bringing liquids through airport security. The fact that cabin crew have access to a toxic fire extinguisher and an axe but we can't bring a yogurt or water to work seems completely ridiculous and potentially unsafe.

attributes.action: Have an official public inquiry into Deepcut Army Barracks
attributes.background:
Deepcut Army Barracks in Surrey has been the focus of the recent inquiry into how Private Cheryl James died at the barracks. 
Nobody will ever know the truth unfortunately but the hard fought battle of the James family has opened up some very searching questions into the home of the RLC
attributes.additional_details:
As a former soldier and trainee at Deepcut I wanted to start this online petition to get the government to start opening up about what went on at this place. I was recently involved in the BBC 2 documentary "The Army's shame" During my time there I was subjected to and seen physical brutality on a number of levels. 
The government cannot ignore the goings on in Deepcut any longer!! Please take a minute to sign this petition and let's get the ball rolling to getting it discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: Hold a vote of no confidence in Her Majesty's Government
attributes.background: We the undersigned call for a vote of no confidence in Her Majesty's Government, given the divisiveness of the EU referendum, the shockingly poor leadership shown by the current government, and the fact that David Cameron's replacement will not have the mandate of the people.

attributes.action: Guarantee the UK will not introduce Welfare Cards
attributes.background: We the people want Damian Green MP (DWP Minister) to Guarantee that the introduction of Welfare Cards will not be introduced to benefit claimants in the UK which breaches their rights under Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1998/42/schedule/1/part/I/chapter/7

http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-05-04/geraldton-indigenous-elders-reject-cashless-welfare-card-trial/7383366

http://greens.org.au/cashless-card

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Strengthen laws to prosecute individuals who make false allegations of abuse
attributes.background: This petition calls for a Parliamentary debate to review whether current laws relating to the offences of perjury and perverting the course of justice are fit for purpose and that they are being pursued with vigour by the Crown Prosecution Service in cases of false allegations of abuse.
attributes.additional_details: False allegations of sexual and other types of abuse have a catastrophic effect upon the lives of those who are accused. Furthermore, making such allegations, whether motivated by a desire for vengeance, attention or compensation, also casts doubt on genuine complaints of abuse and undermines public confidence in our justice system. A review mechanism whereby compensation awarded to false accusers can be recovered (where convictions are later quashed by the Court of Appeal or the Supreme Court) should exist.

attributes.action: Stop the "closure by stealth" of Cavendish Hospital, Buxton.
attributes.background:
Spencer Ward at the Cavendish Hospital is earmarked for closure under new proposals. 

This will mean that the Cavendish Hospital, will have just 8 Beds to serve the needs of the High Peak area.

This is unacceptable and in short we oppose these changes.
attributes.additional_details:
The consultation began Wednesday 29 June 2016 and closes on Wednesday 5 October 2016.

The proposals are to close more than 100 beds across Nth Derbyshire, who currently care for the elderly and dementia sufferers.

This petition is with particular references to the Cavendish Hospital.

It is unacceptable to expect patients / relatives to travel to CRH  / Walton Hospital for services which are currently provided within the Cavendish. We oppose any changes to the Cavendish.

attributes.action: More inspections required and legislation for CCTV installation in ALL abbatoirs
attributes.background: The govt has no intention of banning religious slaughter we are told. Our custom of stunning is not being carried out all the time nor being checked thoroughly enough with animals suffering intolerably. Secret filming has proved this many times. Suffering must end!

attributes.action: Prevent & Prohibit "Fellatio Cafes" from being established in London & the UK
attributes.background: This Petition asks the UK Government to establish the necessary steps to Prevent & Prohibit "Fellatio Cafes" from being established in the UK. There are plans for "Fellatio Cafes" to open in London & across the UK, serving coffee & food, customers will choose an escort to perform oral sex on them.
attributes.additional_details:
Bradley Charvet, the founder insists "everything related to the (Fellatio Cafe) is legal", But UK Law states "running a brothel" is illegal. What else is this cafe then? Mr Charvet said the cafe would "offer oral sex", there is no difference between oral sex or any other form of sex, he is seeking a legal loop-hole to establish his version of a brothel. The Government must stop this!

http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/london-to-get-coffee-and-fellatio-cafe-a7170266.html

attributes.action: Give the undermanned Coastal Border Control to our Ex-Military.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, want to see our Ex-Military persons off the streets. No soldier should be treated with such disrespect.
attributes.additional_details: Our Coastal Borders are undermanned and underfunded. This should not be the case. Give these wonderful guys/gals the respect they deserve and hire them as Border Controllers.

attributes.action: EXEMPT SUPPORTED HOUSING FROM HOUSING BENEFIT CAP
attributes.background: Proposals to cap housing benefit for supported housing jeopardises the future of this essential accommodation, which provides a home for the country’s most vulnerable citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
The people affected include
•         frail elderly people
•         young people leaving care
•         women fleeing domestic violence
•         people recovering from alcohol and substance misuse
•         people with mental health issues
•         people with physical and/or learning disabilities
•         former military servicemen and women 

We the undersigned therefore call upon HM Government to exempt supported housing from any cap on housing benefit

attributes.action: Stop all payments to Europe from the U.K.
attributes.background: To stop sending money to Eu now

attributes.action: Keep the Free Movement of People Between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Britain has voted to leave the EU. Negotiations will soon begin to decide how Britain and the EU go forward over the next few years. We ask that as part of that negotiation, any Prime Minister will ensure that the free movement of people between the UK and the EU will be retained.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers to declare and label their food halal or kosher
attributes.background: It is in the interests of the people to give them the information about what they eat so they can make an informed decision about the food they eat.  To deny this is denying peoples right to choose.  People have the right to know what they are buying and nothing should be hidden from the consumer.
attributes.additional_details: This work both ways, some people are strongly against the way in which animals are treated before their death and the way in which they are slaughtered.  They do not wish to have any part in the consumption of halal and kosher products.   However, the moslem community do support this and would probably feel better knowing that their food is slaughtered to "halal" guidelines and I am sure the Jewish community would prefer to buy products that are marked "Kosher".

attributes.action: Call a snap general election now that the UK have voted to leave the EU
attributes.background: Call a snap general election now that the UK have voted to leave the EU, so that political parties can tender their manifestos so they can lay out to us the electorate their plans for a UK outside the European Union.

attributes.action: Impose harsher sentences for deaths caused by driving offences
attributes.background: The justice system needs reviewing currently the sentences for driving offences particularly death caused by dangerous driving, careless driving and reckless driving are way too lenient. It gives no consideration to the emotional life long trauma and devastation to the victims families and friends.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple cases to support the leniency of the criminal justice in relation to driving offences - there are stricter sentences for assault, theft and non payment of council tax.  It seems that there is little value placed on human life which is utterly abhorrent.

attributes.action: Make sales of MOD land for development conditional to include Veterans housing
attributes.background:
The current shortage of housing stock is forcing many vulnerable and homeless Veterans into the private rental market which many cannot afford.
We want all future MOD land/building sales for development to be sold with condition that new houses include a % of social housing for Veterans in need.
attributes.additional_details: This would greatly alleviate the demands placed on the finances of local authorities, housing associations and charities which are having to pay to house vulnerable Veterans.

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: Make sex education compulsory, with lessons on consent and sexual orientations
attributes.background: In February, Nicky Morgan said that sex education would no longer be compulsory. Yet it is vital that young people are informed about practicing safe sex, what consent is and its importance and sexual orientations in order to prevent unwanted pregnancies, STDs, rape & confusion about sexual identity
attributes.additional_details: According to the Office for National Statistics, "Nearly three-quarters (73%) of female victims of rape offences and over three-quarters (78%) of female victims of other sexual offences recorded by the police were aged under 30. Male victims of rape and other sexual offences were even more likely to be aged under 30 (88% and 84% respectively)," in the year ending March 2015. It is crucial that young people know what consent is, how to give/receive consent and tear sex without consent is rape

attributes.action: Have an independent investigation into BBC Impartiality & Neutrality
attributes.background: The BBC Claims to be neutral and impartial. The Left claim it is very right-wing, the Right claim it is very left-wing. BBC Reluctant to investigate itself and is arrogant when suggested that it is not impartial.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC seem reluctant to investigate themselves, and they appear arrogant when suggested that they are not impartial. But some went to the same schools and universities as politicians they may be involved with, or even members of the same clubs. This is why the investigation needs to be by somebody who would not let this influence them.

attributes.action: Ban the export of live farmed animals
attributes.background: Since we have now decided rightly or wrongly to leave the EU, we the undersigned believe that the UK should demonstrate that we care about animal welfare and ban the export of live farmed animals.
attributes.additional_details:
In response to a prior petition, (https://petition.parliament.uk/archived/petitions/42002) the authorities stated that "To ban the trade . . . would be illegal and would undermine the principle of the free-movement of goods enshrined in the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union." 

We, the undersigned, do not believe that animals are "goods" and would like the Government to stop farmed animals raised in the UK from being sent overseas.

attributes.action: Declare the result of the EU referendum null & void.
attributes.background: Voters may have been influenced by false information sent to them by the Vote Leave campaign, whose campaign  leaflet claimed that the cost of UK membership of the EU is £350M per week, which is false.
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/cameron-bbcqt-eu-referendum-special-myths/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36014941

attributes.action: Remove EU flags from public buildings immediately because of the EU result.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, have decided to remove ourselves from the European Union via a referendum. We now demand the removal of the symbol of the EU, namely their flag, to be removed from all public buildings with immediate effect.

attributes.action: For it to be standard, regular, practice to measure babies' heads.
attributes.background: Poppy's story! On August 25th Poppy's parents received the devastating news that she had water on the brain along with tumours. If Poppy's head had been measured they would have known it was the size of a 2 year old, having JUST turned one!
attributes.additional_details: Poppy's head was 6cm too big and had never been measured/recorded in her red book. Poppy is currently, with her parents, in HDU in Manchester Children's Hospital awaiting her fourth brain operation!

attributes.action: Make Strangles a Notifiable Disease
attributes.background: Strangles is a deadly and horrific disease in horses. Bacteria is spread through direct and indirect contact. It causes horses great distress and pain and is difficult to deal with. Outbreaks are currently managed by the common sense of horse owners but often still result in spread of the disease.
attributes.additional_details: It often happens that outbreaks are kept secret and advised biosecurity is not adhered to correctly. Horse Welfare is the biggest concern as containment procedures are optional, meaning that it often spreads and more horses suffer. The damage to the equine industry is great; entire show seasons lost, loss of livestock, and loss of income. Were it a notifiable disease anyone who had a case would not be able to keep it secret and they would have to put correct biosecurity measures in place by law.

attributes.action: The Ministry of Defence to regulate All  Forces Charities.
attributes.background:
There are far to many  Military Charities,  unchecked and uncontrolled, resulting in public donations being syphoned off,  'for Admin charges'
Bogus charities and their collection agencies, are amoral and in many cases actively  criminal.
HM Forces, Veterans and their Families deserve better.
attributes.additional_details:
The Prime Minister do, with immediate effect,  bring forward legislation,  for the Ministry of Defence to regulate All  Forces Charities. There are far to many  so called Military Charities  springing up daily,  unchecked and uncontrolled, with the result that donated money, from the supporting UK public, is being syphoned off, 'for Admin charges?'
The activities of these bogus charities and their collection agencies, are amoral and in many cases actively  criminal.

attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory tick treatment for dogs entering the UK
attributes.background: In 2012 the requirement for dogs entering the UK was dropped. Dogs encountering ticks abroad may be exposed to pathogens not present in the UK with the risk of tick-borne disease being brought back to the UK. This puts not only dogs, but humans at risk.

attributes.action: For the court to issue a consecutive sentence and not concurrent.
attributes.background: If a civil servant is assaulted doing their duties and if the person is convicted in court they should get a consecutive sentence to any other convictions and not a concurrent sentence. If that person is serving a life sentence, when granted parole it is then added past their parole date.
attributes.additional_details: Having been assaulted myself where the perpetrator was given a concurrent sentence, where this left me feeling let down by the justice system. More recently a colleague was hit 4 times with a metal pole over his back while dealing with another incident and the perpetrator was given a 4 month concurrent sentence. This is during the zero tolerance to violence which the civil service champions, but when the prisoner is given a concurrent sentence it doesn't send the message of zero tolerance.

attributes.action: Air-drop life saving aid into the starving cities in Syria.
attributes.background: As you may be aware, the situation in Syria has become critical this week. Aid is being blocked from reaching major cities, Russian and Assad forces have heavily increased their air strikes, targeting and destroying the only remaining hospital in Eastern Aleppo. The time to act is now.
attributes.additional_details: After attending an APPG friends of Syria discussion in the Houses of Parliament today, Raed Saleh, Head of Syrian Civil Defense informed us that within 20 days, a quarter of the people trapped in Aleppo will have starved to death, 100,00 of them are children. Aid has been blocked and bombing has increased. British planes use the airspace above these cities on their coalition operations. Use this advantage to drop vital aid to the people below. There is no excuse not to act immediately.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the death penalty once the UK leaves the European Union.
attributes.background: Once UK leaves the European Union, we do petition Her Majesty's Government to repeal the Human Rights Act and withdraw from any treaties necessary to permit capital punishment to be reintroduced as a punishment against particularly abhorrent crimes such as murder and certain sexual crimes.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS closure of the Royal Brompton hospital heart unit.
attributes.background: The Royal Brompton hospital has helped thousands of both adults and children who are born with heart problems. The unit continues to meet all NHS standards and is a leading heart unit. They helped to save my life as a child and they still look after me. They off great support and treatment

attributes.action: Reverse the unfair changes to the State Pension Age imposed on 1950's women.
attributes.background: Thousands of women born in the 1950's expected to receive their State Pension when they reached 60 and planned accordingly. The speed at which the SP changes were introduced and for many with little or no notice has deprived them of their rightful pension. Our SP was earned - it is not a benefit.

attributes.action: Remove VAT (20%) on AEDs (Automated External Defibrillators)
attributes.background: Help us remove VAT on lifesaving defibrillators.  Did you know Scouts and Guides, Cubs and Brownies, Beavers and Rainbows all have to pay 20% VAT for this emergency life-saving equipment. It is wrong. These are the keenest young people to train and encourage with basic life support skills.
attributes.additional_details:
More defibrillators would be available if this ridiculous tax was removed. This will encourage more young people in their thousands to grow up as the next generation with life-saving skills and a keenness to help others.  Signing this petition could save a life!

Cheaper AEDs (No VAT)
= more AEDs in communities 
+ more young, prepared people to assist victims when a SCA has occurred 
= MORE LIVES BEING SAVED
…..Let’s make it happen

attributes.action: Amend existing Hate Crime legislation to specifically include disabled people.
attributes.background:
Hate crimes are recorded for disabled people, however the criminal offences detailing hate crime, do not cover disabled people.
Crime & Disorder Act 1998 "Hostility on the grounds of race & religion"
Public Order Act 1986 "Stirring up hatred on the grounds of race, religion & sexual orientation"
attributes.additional_details:
Legislation needs to be clear and precise in its definition of the people targeted by hate crime and in the sentencing of those who commit hate crimes. It is a unique offence and needs to protect all those whose lives are devastated or ended through hatred. 
Disabled people cannot choose not to be disabled. 
Disabled people need the law to be amended to offer them full protection and to serve as a deterrent in sentencing those, motivated by hatred & hostility, who commit targeted offences.

attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Government’s small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservatives’ as-yet unkept “Votes for Life” manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: Condemn UNESCO and suspend any Government funding
attributes.background: On 13th October 2016, UNESCO, passed a draft resolution denying Jewish connections with The Temple Mount. This resolution is inherently Anti-Semitic  We call on the Government to condemn the resolution and suspend payments to UNESCO until its charter revokes any further racist abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Jerusalem is mentioned 806 times in the Old Testament. The Temple Mount was the the site to which Abraham  took Isaac was the home to five Jewish Temples, and has been the focal point of Jewish prayers since. 
The Palestinians have a long history of abusing UN bodies in an attempt to deligitimise Jewish claims to The Holy Land. 
This latest resolution at UNESCO is not only Anti-Semitic in challenging the fundamental belief of Jews but also challenges the fundamental basis of  Christianity

attributes.action: Reconsideration of Eric Pickles' decision in 2014 to approve a SRFI in St Albans
attributes.background: In light of Greg Clark's decision in July 2016 dismissing an appeal to build a International Freight Exchange on green belt in Colnbrook, we ask the new SOS for Communities and Local Government to use Greg Clark's criteria to overturn approval for a Strategic Rail Freight Interchange in St Albans.
attributes.additional_details: After the SOS twice refused planning permission for a SRFI development on 300 acres of green belt in St Albans, Hertfordshire, Eric Pickles changed his mind and approved it in July 2014 without allowing a conjoined enquiry with Colnbrook. Greg Clark in turning down the Colnbrook development concluded "that the benefits of the scheme do not clearly overcome the harm. Consequently very special circumstances do not exist to justify the development."(on green belt)

attributes.action: Award of a National Defence Medal
attributes.background: I propose an award of a National Defence Medal to all serving and ex- serving members of HM Forces in recognition of the service that they have given/give to their country and to the people, subject to meeting certain criteria.
attributes.additional_details:
Not everyone was able to go into a war like zone but they nevertheless gave 100% effort.

Please recognise their efforts.

http://nationaldefencemedal.webs.com/Submission%20for%20the%20UK%20National%20Defence%20Medal.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA
attributes.background: Re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA as it is impacting so many of IT Professionals lives who strongly wish to live and work in UK.
attributes.additional_details: There are number of IT professionals who has taken their education and started working in UK struggling a lot due to the restrictions on TIER 2 General VISA. So taking all the problems into consideration kindly re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA as it is impacting so many of IT Professionals lives who strongly wish to live and work in UK.
